name: !DOCTYPE
description: Declares the document type and version of HTML.
notes: Must be the first item in an HTML document.

name: html
description: Represents the root of an HTML document.
notes: All other elements must be descendants of this element.

name: head
description: Contains machine-readable information (metadata) about the document.
notes: Contains metadata, title, styles, and scripts.

name: title
description: Defines the document's title that is shown in a browser's title bar or a page's tab.
notes: Required in all HTML documents.

name: body
description: Represents the content of an HTML document.
notes: There can be only one <body> element in a document.

name: base
description: Specifies the base URL to use for all relative URLs in a document.
notes: Must be placed in the <head> section. Only one <base> element is allowed.

name: link
description: Specifies relationships between the current document and an external resource.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: Relationship between current document and linked resource

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: MIME type of the linked resource

attributes.name: media
attributes.description: Media type for which the linked resource was designed

notes: Commonly used for linking stylesheets.

name: meta
description: Represents metadata that cannot be represented by other HTML meta-related elements.
notes: Used for character encoding, viewport settings, and other metadata.

name: style
description: Contains style information for a document, or part of a document.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: MIME type of the style language

attributes.name: media
attributes.description: Media type for which the styles were designed

notes: Contains CSS rules.

name: address
description: Represents contact information for the author/owner of a document.
notes: Typically used in the <footer> section of a document.

name: article
description: Represents a self-contained composition in a document.
notes: Use for blog posts, forum posts, news stories, comments, etc.

name: aside
description: Represents content indirectly related to the main content.
notes: Often used for sidebars, pull quotes, or advertisements.

name: footer
description: Represents a footer for its nearest sectioning content or sectioning root element.
notes: Typically contains authorship, copyright, contact info, or related links.

name: header
description: Represents introductory content, typically a group of introductory or navigational aids.
notes: Can contain headings, logo, search form, etc.

name: h1
description: Represents the top-level heading.
notes: Should be used once per page for the main title.

name: h2
description: Represents a second-level heading.
notes: Used for major section headings.

name: h3
description: Represents a third-level heading.
notes: Used for subsection headings.

name: h4
description: Represents a fourth-level heading.
notes: Used for sub-subsection headings.

name: h5
description: Represents a fifth-level heading.
notes: Used for minor headings.

name: h6
description: Represents the lowest-level heading.
notes: Used for the least important headings.

name: hgroup
description: Represents a multi-level heading for a section of a document.
notes: Groups related headings together.

name: main
description: Represents the dominant content of the body of a document.
notes: Should not include content that is repeated across pages.

name: nav
description: Represents a section of a page whose purpose is to provide navigation links.
notes: Intended for major navigation blocks.

name: section
description: Represents a standalone section of functionality or content.
notes: Should have a heading and represent a thematic grouping of content.

name: div
description: A generic container for flow content with no special meaning.
notes: Use when no other semantic element is appropriate.

name: p
description: Represents a paragraph.
notes: Automatically creates line breaks before and after.

name: hr
description: Represents a thematic break between paragraph-level elements.
notes: Self-closing tag. Represents a horizontal rule or break.

name: pre
description: Represents preformatted text which is to be presented exactly as written.
notes: Preserves whitespace and line breaks.

name: blockquote
description: Represents a section that is quoted from another source.

attributes.name: cite
attributes.description: URL of the source of the quotation

notes: Use <cite> element to reference the source.

name: ol
description: Represents an ordered list of items.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of numbering (1, A, a, I, i)

attributes.name: reversed
attributes.description: Whether the list should be displayed in descending order

notes: Items are automatically numbered.

name: ul
description: Represents an unordered list of items.
notes: Items are typically displayed with bullets.

name: li
description: Represents an item in a list.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Ordinal value of the list item

notes: Must be contained within <ol>, <ul>, or <menu>.

name: dl
description: Represents a description list.
notes: Contains <dt> (term) and <dd> (description) elements.

name: dt
description: Represents a term in a description list.
notes: Must be contained within <dl>.
